title: Chinese censors were busy scrubbing commentary on the case of Xia Junfeng -- a recently executed Chinese...

attachments.displayName:
Chinese censors were busy scrubbing commentary on the case of Xia Junfeng -- a recently executed Chinese street vendor -- from micro-blogs on Wednesday and Thursday. But one haunting image can still be easily found: a painting by Xia’s 13-year-old son. In vivid blues, yellows, and greens, the self-portrait depicts the son riding piggyback, clasping his father’s supportive shoulders, both of them smiling serenely. One of Xia and Zhang’s dreams had been to scrape together enough money to send their son to art school.

http://www.businessweek.com/articles/2013-09-26/xia-junfeng-a-street-vendor-riles-chinas-social-media-after-his-execution-in-murder-case

object.content:
Chinese censors were busy scrubbing commentary on the case of Xia Junfeng -- a recently executed Chinese street vendor -- from micro-blogs on Wednesday and Thursday. But one haunting image can still be easily found: a painting by Xia’s 13-year-old son. In vivid blues, yellows, and greens, the self-portrait depicts the son riding piggyback, clasping his father’s supportive shoulders, both of them smiling serenely. One of Xia and Zhang’s dreams had been to scrape together enough money to send their son to art school.

http://www.businessweek.com/articles/2013-09-26/xia-junfeng-a-street-vendor-riles-chinas-social-media-after-his-execution-in-murder-case

So many losers in this tale.  The two chengguan and their family are victims too. They probably didn't start out violent men, but the system set them on a path that they didn't have the strength, luck and ability to get away from.

title: Google+ List of Comments for an Activity
